channel.title: Need help with npc drops
channel.description: can anybody tell me how or give me a good TuT i've looked for a TuT but i couldn't find any. Any help will be appreciated

item.title: Need help with npc drops
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

[quote=“monkey money30, post:16, topic:233261”][quote author=tonypker13 link=topic=307605.msg2459653#msg2459653 date=1222433107]

open NPCDROPS.CFG and open it with notepad and then look up id of what npc is and it says what it drops and you can change it to the items or the amount you want of it ok.
so i hope i helped alot ;D or a bit lol…

Ok i’ve now quoted you on 3 posts in 2 minutes… all 3 posts have been wrong… please know what your saying before posting.
[/quote]
well i hoped you read what i said coz i said nothing wrong[/quote]
On the different posts… youv’e said things that will work 0%…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with npc drops
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I can make it a specific percentage of drops, like 1% for whip, 95% for bones, etc.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 26, 2008, 04:39:29 am[/size][hr]AllStar is easily crashable, I suggest you change sources.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with npc drops
item.dc:creator: @zacstrex zacstrex
item.description:
@zacstrex wrote:

[quote=“mathew000000000, post:4, topic:233261”]WRONG!

Drops are based off of i think 2 or 3 files

First go into NpcHandler.java

look up a monster that you know has a drop for eg.

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1605) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item.randomSlayer99item(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

To edit the drops (Note if you want 100% Drops you add just 1 if you want random drops you add many diffrent items)
Go into Item handler or what file it says here

ItemHandler.addItem(Item.randomSlayer99item(),

in item.java search up the

randomSlayer99item()

You will see somthing like this and to add or remove items just delete or add the item id in it…

public static int slayer99items[] = { 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 2653, 2655, 4834, 4834, 2597, 2593, 2595, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 2587, 2587, 3054, 4834, 4834, 2651, 2577, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834}; public static int randomSlayer99item() { return slayer99items[(int) (Math.random() * slayer99items.length)]; }

A small tut for you :D[/quote] i have Allstar source i think yours goes with mine thanx i’ll try it out

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with npc drops
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

The 1st number is the NPC ID.
The 2nd number is the drop ID.
The 3rd number the amount of the drop.
The 4th number is the percentage it is going to drop the item.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 26, 2008, 04:35:49 am[/size][hr][quote=“mathew000000000, post:4, topic:233261”]WRONG!

Drops are based off of i think 2 or 3 files

First go into NpcHandler.java

look up a monster that you know has a drop for eg.

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1605) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item.randomSlayer99item(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

To edit the drops (Note if you want 100% Drops you add just 1 if you want random drops you add many diffrent items)
Go into Item handler or what file it says here

ItemHandler.addItem(Item.randomSlayer99item(),

in item.java search up the

randomSlayer99item()

You will see somthing like this and to add or remove items just delete or add the item id in it…

public static int slayer99items[] = { 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 2653, 2655, 4834, 4834, 2597, 2593, 2595, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 2587, 2587, 3054, 4834, 4834, 2651, 2577, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834}; public static int randomSlayer99item() { return slayer99items[(int) (Math.random() * slayer99items.length)]; }

A small tut for you :D[/quote]

No, on my source it is only one file.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with npc drops
item.dc:creator: @mathew000000000 mathew000000000
item.description:
@mathew000000000 wrote:

WRONG!

Drops are based off of i think 2 or 3 files

First go into NpcHandler.java

look up a monster that you know has a drop for eg.

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1605) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item.randomSlayer99item(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

To edit the drops (Note if you want 100% Drops you add just 1 if you want random drops you add many diffrent items)
Go into Item handler or what file it says here

ItemHandler.addItem(Item.randomSlayer99item(),

in item.java search up the

randomSlayer99item()

You will see somthing like this and to add or remove items just delete or add the item id in it…

public static int slayer99items[] = { 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 2653, 2655, 4834, 4834, 2597, 2593, 2595, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 2587, 2587, 3054, 4834, 4834, 2651, 2577, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834, 4834}; public static int randomSlayer99item() { return slayer99items[(int) (Math.random() * slayer99items.length)]; }

A small tut for you
